turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Claire...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: DJ!  It's okay. You're okay. Just breathe.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Here's another one. They're all over the place.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: They're explosive charges.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Dr. Weir, what's this the door to?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: You're at the Bridge, Ms. Peters. You still haven't seen any crew?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes, we can see some kind of mist. What is that?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Blood. Looks like arterial spray.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Can you see a body?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: There's no one here.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: No. I saw nothing.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: About an hour ago. In medical. I saw my son. He was lying on one of the examination tables and his legs were...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Isn't it possible that you were traumatized by finding the body on the bridge?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I've seen bodies before. This is different.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: There's no one in the corridor but us.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Not according to the computer.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: He's engaged the override.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Can you shut it down?

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Yes. Yes, Justin, we heard it.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Keep him talking.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Do you know what it was?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Almost got it.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: Come on, Baby-bear, open this door...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: We have to do something, oh God...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Skipper, Justin just activated the door. It's on a thirty second delay...

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: You got any coffee?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: It's cold.

turns.speaker: PETERS
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Say this paper represents space-time, and you want to get from "point A" here...  ...to "point B," here.  Now: what's the shortest distance between two points?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Dead ahead, 5000 meters.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Jesus, that is one big ugly fat fucker...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: She's not ugly.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Foredecks. Crew quarters, bridge, medical and science labs, hydroponics, what have you. That central section connects the forward decks to the Engineering containment area. Can we move in closer?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Shit, Doc, any closer and we're gonna need a rubber...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: That's the Core: the gravity drive. The heart of the ship.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: The safety circuit's failed!

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: We're losing atmosphere...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It still has air and reserve power, we can activate gravity and life support.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I didn't see anything and I don't have to see anything. This ship is fucked.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Thank you for that scientific analysis, Mister Smith.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Hey! You don't need to be a scientist figure it out...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I can't believe this, I haven't gotten more than my hand in six weeks and now this shit. Why not Mars, Cap, Mars has women...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Smith's right. Neptune? There's nothing out there. If something happens, we'll be on our own.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: 30 hours to Neptune orbit.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: All boards are green, everything's five by five.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: You can't do that.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: The law of relativity prohibits faster- than-light travel...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: This is U.S. Aerospace Command vessel Lewis and Clark, hailing Event Horizon, Event Horizon, do you read...? This is the Lewis and Clark, hailing...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Matching speed... now. Range to target ten thousand meters and closing... Skipper, I got a bad feeling about this...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: If they are, they're screening their calls.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Range 3000 meters and closing.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: The scope is lit, it's right in front of us...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: 1000 meters...

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Range 500 meters and holding. Turbulence is dropping off...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Picking up magnetic interference.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What happened to his eyes?

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Explosive decompression.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Decompression wouldn't do that.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Miller, do you read me, Peters --

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: Get them back --

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I'm trying, goddammit --

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What if the air has gone bad? We can't wear these suits forever.

turns.speaker: SMITH
turns.text: I don't think this is a good idea, we don't even know what happened on that ship...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Relativity, yes. We can't break the law of relativity, but we can go around it. The ship doesn't really move faster than the speed of light; it creates a dimensional gateway that allows the ship to instantaneously "jump" from one point in the universe to another, light years away.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Well, in layman's terms, you use a rotating magnetic field to focus a narrow beam of gravitons; these in turn fold space-time consistent with Weyl tensor dynamics until the space- time curvature becomes infinitely large and you have a singularity...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: A straight line.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Wrong. The shortest distance between two points...

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: The reactor's still hot. We've got several small radiation sources, leaks probably. Nothing serious.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Do they have pressure?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Affirmative. The hull's intact... but there's no gravity and the thermal units are off line. I'm showing deep cold. The crew couldn't survive unless they were in stasis.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Could it be the crew? If they were in suspended animation, wouldn't that effect the scan?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: If they were in stasis, I'd get a location, but these readings, they're all over the ship. It doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Ship's log.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I don't know. The life readings just went off the scale.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: That's how the gravity drive works, you see: it focuses the black hole's immense gravitational power to create the gateway. That's how the Event Horizon travels faster than light.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I can't believe we built this.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Why Dr. Weir, I think you're in love.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Hmmm. Claire used to tell me I loved the Event Horizon more than I loved her. I told her that wasn't true, I just knew the Event Horizon better, that's all.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Claire is your wife?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: It must be hard, being so far away from her.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: Yes. I miss her. She died. Two years now.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Maybe a power interruption crashed the system...

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: No, there's no evidence of a surge or spike of any kind. It's as if time just... stopped for seven years.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It wants me. I have to go.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: In our current environment, Dr. Weir, self-control is an asset.

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: I'm alright. Please.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: The forward airlock.

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Miller, Smith, Cooper, any of you in the airlock?

turns.speaker: STARCK
turns.text: Justin said something about, "The dark inside me..." What did he mean?

turns.speaker: WEIR
turns.text: It means nothing.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I don't think She's real big on hate.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You wouldn't say that, if you could see me.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Such a sad face... You know, sometimes being different isn't a bad thing.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Trust me, this ain't one of those times.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How'd you know it was me?

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I'm blind, not deaf. Wanna come in?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm not really dressed for a party.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Relax, it's casual.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No, I mean... I'm a little... dusty...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Those yours too?

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: My step-dad's. I'm strictly into stone. I was wondering when you'd walk by.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: We're going to have to work on your touch.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I like the sound of that.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: You know, you could'a run an ad in the personals.

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: "Sensual blind chick seeks three- ton, rock-hard he-man for deep spiritual relationship."

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: This ain't permanent. My friend Reed's working on a cure... I think.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: You don't know what it's like out there. Walking around like some kind of circus freak. People staring, whispering --

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: I wouldn't know anything about that.

turns.speaker: THE THING
turns.text: I mean...

turns.speaker: ALICIA
turns.text: Tell me. When you grew up in Brooklyn, how many astronauts did you know?  You went your own way then. You didn't listen to people. So why start now...?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Way to not overthink it.  So when do we leave?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I'll schedule the launch. Call me in the morning to talk about resources and crew.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I can handle the ship. I can even handle Mr. Blonde Ambition. But I don't know if I should be flying or playing Vegas in these suits. Who the hell came up with them?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Victor did.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: We can monitor the cloud's approach and observe the tests from here.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Is it safe?

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: I can only stay for one drink, Ben. I've got to meet with Victor.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Wouldn't want to keep Vic waiting.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: We need to give you a physical, so we know what got zapped.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well why didn't you say so? You want me to lift some weights or something?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You look like an eighties rock band.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: The suit will stretch. You should try it --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I wouldn't be caught dead in that.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: He didn't.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh, he did.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: What did he do to the uniform?!

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: He didn't mean it. You know Johnny. He's always been a hothead --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's not him. It's them.  I can't live like this.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Just give Reed a little more time. You know how he works -- analyzing every little step before he takes one --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's easy for you to be patient.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: No, it's not. I thought I was done waiting for Reed... We're all in this together now, Ben.

turns.speaker: SUE
turns.text: Where is Reed?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Victor must've taken him.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'm worried about you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: About me? How sweet.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Come on. Let me buy you something to eat. Looks like you could use the company.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Ben, come in.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What is this? Where's Reed?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Where do you think? With Sue.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What do you want, Vic?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: To help you. I've run every test known to man. And they all yield the same result: the machine is ready.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed said it'd be weeks till --

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: He also said we'd avoid that storm in space. And we know how that turned out.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: He couldn't generate enough power for the machine to reach critical mass. Yet another mistake for "Mr. Fantastic."

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: And you can? Power it up?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'll be watching over you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Just get back soon, or I start looking for a new groom.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that in for a bigger rock.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I don't care about rocks, I care about you.  You bring him back in one piece, or you can forget being Best Man.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Deb... It's me. I need you to step out front.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Out front? You home, baby? I got a surprise for you.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Don't come any closer for a sec. This is gonna be kind of a shock... You remember when we said "together forever no matter what"?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Baby, you're scaring me.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Oh my G-g-g. What did you... do to Ben?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Deb, it's me. It's still me.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: What did you wish for, honey?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I already got it. Everything I want.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Good thing it ain't workin... Reed, what are we doing here? This guy's fast-food, strip-mall science --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: This wasn't our first stop, in case you forgot NASA. And Victor's not that bad. He's just a little...  Larger than life.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's financed some of the biggest breakthroughs of this century.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You'd never know it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I can't take this.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben. This is business. Just work.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What about his first born?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, the money's not important. We could save lives.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He knew about NASA. What if he made the call to shut us down --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, think about all the people we can help if this works --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Maybe you should think about yourself for once. You always let this guy push you round --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We got what we wanted. That's enough.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know, I know. I'm just worried about what he wants... Speaking of which...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Can't do it. I cannot do it.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: External SRBs, orbital system engines. Its just like the shuttles you flew in --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: No. I cannot take orders from that underwear model. That wingnut washed out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria Secret wannabes into a flight simulator.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Youthful high spirits.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: They crashed it into a wall. A flight simulator.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I'm sure he's matured since then.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: When have I asked you to do something you absolutely said you could not do?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Five times.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I had it at four.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: This makes five.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Isn't that your speech?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's made a few changes.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: This is your dream, Reed. You should be the one up there.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Victor's better at these things.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: The shields on the station should protect us.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Should?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I ain't done arranging your flowers, egghead.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben. This is serious. Turn around.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: How long was I out?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Three days. I was worried about you. How are you feeling?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Solid.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I don't know. I just keep going over and over the numbers.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed. Even you can't compute every little thing.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: I should have done more, run more tests --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You go through something like this, makes you appreciate having the right woman in your life.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed, I'm not talking about Debbie.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: What? Come on. She's got a good thing with Victor --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen your screws?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: He's smart, powerful, successful --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Well maybe you should date him.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I think I need to lie down. Bad shrimp.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What the --!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben. Are you okay?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Am I okay?! You wanna explain that?!

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We had a tough year.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah, nine years straight.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You got a chisel round here?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: If we're going to identify the source of the mutation, we need to isolate your recombinant DNA so we can activate positional genomes.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Okay. I've uh, got some questions, from Sue. That she thought might be better coming from me... Can you, you know, go to the bathroom... like normal...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah.  You don't wanna know the details.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I'm afraid I've got to ask --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Not unless you want that clipboard stretched up your --

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: O-kay. We'll skip that question.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It's about to be a broken face.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: This isn't permanent, Johnny. We need to be careful until we're normal again.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh, you remember my name do you? You happen to remember what you swore to do with every breath in your body?

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: We're working as hard as we can --

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah. I can tell. Victor was right.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Glad "nothing" could take you away from your work.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I don't know if this thing'll change us back or make us worse. I need you to be patient for a little while longe--

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Time for your lesson, Vic. Chem 101: what happens when you supercool hot metal...?  Ben...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Got it, teach.

turns.speaker: REED
turns.text: Ben, I've been crunching the numbers on the machine. I think if we can rework the power settings...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Forget it, egghead. I'm good as is.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What the hell you smiling at? Just keep your mouth shut, and your mind on those SMBs --

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Actually, the engines are SMEs. Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant. Couple generations past your last ride.  I'm not as dumb as you look.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: If you behave, maybe next time daddy'll let you drive.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Keep talking, there won't be a next time.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Please tell me your dawg's not trying to rekindle things with my sister.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: 'Course not. Strictly business.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yeah, well, his eyes say different.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hey, two hearts got busted last time. Maybe she's not over it either.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the year, more coin than God? Or Reed, the world's dumbest smart guy worth less than a postage stamp. Hmmm, it's a toss-up.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Put your tiny little mind at ease.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Don't you wander off, boy.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Where... where am I?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Back on Earth. Victor's medical facility... We're in quarantine.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Reed?... Sue?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: They're fine. Everybody else... is fine.
